profiles: Experience Postdoctoral Teaching Fellow Stanford University Postdoctoral Teaching Fellow Stanford University Postdoctoral Teaching Fellow Stanford University

Summary My current research and publication interests are in technology and writing, digital literacy and visual communication. I have taught academic writing, oral communication, visual design in advertising and information design at Stanford. As an Assistant Director at Hume Center of Writing and Speaking, I launched graduate services that included writing consultations, writing workshops across disciplines, and Dissertation Bootcamps (2008-2010). I also founded the Digital Media Program at Hume as Associate Director (2011-2012).  
 
I have over fifteen years of experience teaching writing, rhetoric, and literature. I have helped writers on doctoral dissertations, grant proposals, job and graduate school applications, book manuscripts, speeches and talks, web, academic posters, PowerPoint and print design. I am especially interested in visual design, information design, branding, and advertising.  
 
I am co-author of The Routledge Reader on Writing Centers and New Media, (Routledge 2013). Currently, I am working on a college textbook, Design for Composition, and researching multimodal communication across disciplines. Summary I’ve been employed in many different capacities in my life, but in the past twelve years I’ve primarily taught philosophy (mostly ethics, political philosophy, and philosophy of religion) to undergraduates. In this process, I’ve honed my critical thinking skills -- especially in relationship to being able to find creative solutions to problems. I’ve also increased my ability to both manage and teach others in various ways, as well as effectively working together with peers to develop new paths to achieve desired outcomes.  
 
Specialties: Teaching, public speaking, research, personnel management, knowledge management, ethics, political philosophy, philosophy of religion Summary I’ve been employed in many different capacities in my life, but in the past twelve years I’ve primarily taught philosophy (mostly ethics, political philosophy, and philosophy of religion) to undergraduates. Experience Storyteller, researcher Silk Road House 2013  – Present (2 years) Berkeley, CA Lecturer Saint Mary's College of California February 2012  – Present (3 years 7 months) I am teaching in the Collegiate Seminar Program, a required two-year sequence of humanities courses for incoming students. Storyteller and historian Stagebridge Theater Company 2009  – Present (6 years) San Francisco Bay Area I was once a respectable historian of Russia. Then, I turned to a life of storytelling, crafting stories that transform historical events into tales of wonder and horror. I also tell traditional, literary, and original tales to young and adult audiences alike. Summary Ecologist and teacher. As an ecologist, I conduct research in microbial ecology and biogeochemistry with experience in academic and government settings. As a teacher, I am interested in science and environmental education at all levels. Summary Ecologist and teacher. As an ecologist, I conduct research in microbial ecology and biogeochemistry with experience in academic and government settings. As a teacher, I am interested in science and environmental education at all levels. Ecologist and teacher. As a teacher, I am interested in science and environmental education at all levels. Experience Gordon and Betty Moore Postdoctoral Fellow of the Life Sciences Research Foundation the University of Arizona November 2013  – Present (1 year 10 months) Tucson, AZ Conducting research in Betsy Arnold's lab focused on understanding the different factors affecting the life histories of foliar fungi, primarily based on greenhouse experiments and meta-transcriptomic methods. Postdoctoral Teaching Fellow Stanford University March 2013  –  June 2013  (4 months) Coordinated and taught (with a team of other instructors and teaching assistants) an introductory ecology field and lab course to ~120 upper level undergraduates. Course content focused on the microbial ecology of communities of microorganisms in floral nectar, and included field observations at Jasper Ridge Biological Preserve, molecular and culture based methods for microbe community quantification, and statistical analyses in the R programming language. PhD Candidate in Ecology Stanford University September 2007  –  March 2013  (5 years 7 months) Dissertation research focused on microbial community ecology at the landscape scale using next-generation sequencing techniques - specifically with an interest in understanding how symbiotic organisms shape their hosts' function in ecosystems. Tutor Stutors November 2008  –  June 2010  (1 year 8 months) Tutored elementary to college students in a range of subjects (Math, English, Biology, Chemistry, Environmental Science), writing skills, and test prep (SSAT/ISEE, CSU Writing Proficiency Exam, SAT, SAT II, ACT, APs, GRE). Teacher IBS Academy August 2006  –  August 2007  (1 year 1 month) Taught a variety of AP subjects (Macro/Micro Economics, Biology, Chemistry, Calculus) and test preparation (AP, SAT I/II, GRE, TOEFL) at a private academy in Seoul, South Korea. Research Technician Harvard University September 2005  –  July 2006  (11 months) Technician in the Schrag Geochemical Oceanography Lab working on past climate reconstruction using isotopic techniques. Research Intern USDA Forest Service 2003  –  2005  (2 years) Conducted field ecology research on community vegetation ecology, succession, and invasive species - with a focus on lowland wet forests and the invasive tree Psidium cattleianum (strawberry guava).
